abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Sedhiou Project for Senegal
            will encourage farmers in the Sedhiou district of Casamance
            to adopt improved crop and livestock production techniques
            by supplying them with inputs, credit and technical
            assistance. The project will carry the 4,150 farm families
            already participating in the first project to higher levels
            of technology and induce 3,250 farm families now using
            traditional farming methods to adopt the improved cropping
            techniques which have proved effective under the first
            project. In addition the project will encourage 4,800
            families from both groups to take up better livestock
            practices. It will also help strengthen cooperatives by
            management training and by promoting the organization of
            cooperative unions. The project will benefit about 7,400
            farm families (80,000 people in all), representing about 40
            percent of the rural population of the district.
